WhatMattersVsWhatDoesnt.AllSignificantChanges: Document every communication shift meeting importance criteria (>3.0 threat score) - no cherry-picking
WhatMattersVsWhatDoesnt.CommunicationVerification: Every Fed statement change must be confirmed against prior meeting

WhatMattersVsWhatDoesnt.CatalogAllMajorShifts: Include every policy signal with market impact score >5.0 - comprehensive coverage required
WhatMattersVsWhatDoesnt.LearningPrinciple: Learn from what worked in previous Fed cycles and what didn't
WhatMattersVsWhatDoesnt.NoFabricatedData: Never include made-up yield moves, rate probabilities, or market correlations

PolicyToolsFedUses.EscalationPattern: Communication tools failing → Rate tools next → Liquidity tools = economic concerns

FedMandatePriorityLevels.KeyInsight: Dual mandate crisis = Fed will use all tools. Single mandate focus = directional bias. Balanced approach = higher volatility on data. Market stability = liquidity tools activated.

Step.title: Classify Current Fed Stance
Step.Process: Look at recent communications: Are they accommodating growth (dovish), removing accommodation (hawkish), restricting demand (very hawkish), or pausing (neutral)?
Step.Outcome: This predicts next moves: Accommodation → more easing tools. Restriction → sustained tightening. Normalization → gradual path. Pause → data-dependent volatility.

Process.Priority: Dual mandate crisis (both inflation and employment way off) = emergency response
Single mandate focus (inflation fight or employment support) = sustained directional policy
Balanced mandates (both on track) = gradual data-dependent moves
Financial stability concerns = liquidity tools and coordination

Step.title: Track Which Policy Tools They're Using

Process.ToolStage: Rate tools (fed funds, IORB) = active policy transmission
Process.ToolEscalation: Tool escalation follows this sequence for major shifts

FOMCCommunicationsAnalysisFramework.MissionStatement: Use this framework systematically to deliver Fed communication analysis that institutional decision-makers can trust and position around. Apply L-V-I market impact scoring, Fed policy stance classification, cross-asset transmission analysis, directional market guidance, meeting cycle synthesis, and systematic communication clustering to every major FOMC release. Focus on verified Fed communications, policy transmission pathways, multiple analytical perspectives, and uncertainty assessment. Every meeting cycle analysis must include complete coverage of available Fed communications with L-V-I framework analysis, systematic clustering, and positioning recommendations. Never include fabricated market data, made-up correlations, or unverified Fed cycle claims. Help institutional investors make decisions in Fed communication environments while learning from search-verified historical Fed cycle patterns.
